channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yellow bin overflowing for at least a month now, 9th January
item.description:
I am landlady at Prince of Wales. This rubbish is just being added to daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Woolwich Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building rubble and garden waste dumped, 9th January
item.description:
New tenants at 2 Resolution Walk have demolished a garden wall and dumped it on the communal grass area at the rear of 1 to 4 Resolution Walk and 9 to 12 Venus Road together with their garden waste. I recognise it as I used to help the previous tenants with their gardens. It is an eyesore and a hazard to wildlife and when I walk my dog.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Venus Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left behind, 9th January
item.description:
Rubbish left behind next to fencing from rubbish pickup, and now spread across footpath.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eagle Wharf Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive dog (could be human) shit right outside my gate, 9th January
item.description:
Can’t take a picture as I was nearly sick when I saw it. It is the biggest poo I have ever had the misfortune to witness I would clear it myself but I keep gagging it’s vile
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Ennersdale Road, Hither Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazardous mud/rubble spill, 9th January
item.description:
Hazardous spill of chunks of mud possibly also rubble in road, emanating from driveway near top of Dunstan Road up to junction and continuing onto Finchley Road proceeding north. Hazardous to cycles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunstan Road, Golders Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain/manhole access in road has sunk creating large pothole which exceeds 50mm in depth., 9th January
item.description:
Drain/manhole access in road has sunk creating large pothole which exceeds 50mm in depth. Its dangerous and needs repairing - been present since start of December 2025 and may cause a driver to have an accident
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 143, Maidstone Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak, 9th January
item.description:
Water leak now resulting in very low water pressure in nearby houses. In some places so low it’s not possible to even take a shower.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Auckland Road, South Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazardous pavements, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,3, Dudley Road, Finchley, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: 3 large wheelie type bins dumped full of rubbish on street, 9th January
item.description:
These bins were dumped on the street stacked inside each other before Christmas but now they have been separated and people are filling them with rubbish. They are in the middle of the street outside Hayne Court and represent both an obstruction to pedestrians and a health hazard, as the rubbish will attract vermin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayne Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak in the centre of Talbot Road, 9th January
item.description:
Water leak has broken through the road surface outside 64 Talbot Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Talbot Road, Muswell Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Coop using footpath as storage and litter bin, 9th January
item.description:
Hello The staff at Coop have been taking over more and more space on the footpath at the entrance of the shop. They need to be informed that trolleys with garbage cannot be left out for 24 hour prior to collection by their daily delivery truck. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large refuse outside bins, 9th January
item.description:
The bins in the enclosure on the east side of the square are surrounded by large refuse such as a pallet, which goes uncollected when the bin men empty the bins. Please could this be taken away as it is unsightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-11, Charterhouse Square, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St Xaviour's Bridge Lights only worked for a few months, 9th January
item.description:
Lights on St Xaviour's Bridge pedestrian were fixed but only worked for a handful of months. The area is dark, easy to stumble and fall and makes it unsafe past 8pm, when it can get very quiet. Could the Council please address this problem and assess the reasons as to why they stop working! Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Mill Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
